intro: Tibouchina lhotzkyana, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage and clusters of pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is part of the Melastomataceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Tibouchina lhotzkyana is often used in landscaping for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
